resources.string: * Cue ball - the white ball, the only ball that you may hit with the cue\n* Red - red in color, there are 15 at the start of the game\n* Colour - one of the six balls that are neither red nor white

Pot - to put a ball into a pocket (and have it stay there)
Foul - to do something against the rules
Snookered - to be unable to roll the cue ball in a straight line and hit the ball chosen.
Ball ON - the ball you intend to hit with the cue ball

1 - You hit the cue ball so that it, in turn, hits another ball and hopefully pots it.
2 - You must not pot the cue ball
When there are still red balls on the table:
3 - Your first shot on every turn must be to hit a red with the cue ball
4 - If you pot that red (red is the ball ON), then you score 1 point and your next shot may be on any of the colours (be sure to say which one you have chosen). The red stays in the pocket.
5 - If you pot that colour (which is now the ball ON), then you score the value of the colour and your next shot must be a red. The colour goes back on its own spot. If it does not fit on its spot, then it goes on the highest valued spot available.
6 - If you fail to pot, or if you foul, then your turn is ended and your opponent gets to try
7 - continue with red-colour-red-colour until all reds are in the pockets
When all red balls are gone:
8. Balls are pocketed in this order - yellow(2), green(3), brown(4), blue(5), pink(6), black(7). They stay in the pocket.

1 - Once struck, cue ball must make contact with ball ON first otherwise, foul is committed
2 - If your cue ball does not hit anything on the table, your opponent may choose to take the shot or turn the table back to you
3 - If you commit a foul and your opponent is snookered on all balls ON, he may be allowed to select a freeball(any ball on the table). The freeball, for this shot only, becomes another ball ON and has the same value and is re-spotted if potted.
4 - If your cue ball first hits a ball other than the ball ON, then the penalty is the value of the ball struck or 4 points, whichever is greater.
5 - If you pot a ball other than the ball ON, then you do NOT score the value of the ball ON but your opponent scores the value of the ball pocketed.
6 - If you touch any ball on the table at any time,then the penalty is the value of the ball touched or 4 points, whichever is greater.

1. A player resigns because there are not enough balls on the table to make up for the opponent\\\'s score OR he does not have enough options to execute a good snooker to force the opponent into a foul.\n2. All reds and ball colors are pocketed.
The player with the most points at the end of the game wins!

Hi, 

Thanks for trying out my app! I am an amateur app developer with a life long passion for snooker. I wanted to do something for this sport so I set out to create this app in my spare time. My dream is to improve this app constantly and make it useful to the snooker community, by implementing a login to save all previous matches, showing career statistics and adding many new features.

Unfortunately my time and coding skills are not at par with my wishes, so if you feel inspired to help I'd be glad to share in my efforts.

Snooker Board is a simple snooker score keeping app that focuses on recording one full match at a time, with care to encompass all rules from the WPBSA (World Professional Billiards and Snooker Association) Official Rules of the Games of Snooker and Billiards
